channel.title: 2 screens with different desktops
channel.description:
Alright.
I have 2 graphical cards, one Nvidea GeForce FX 5200 and an onboard card. How can i make the onboard card work too, i'm currently using the Nvidea but that disabled my onboard card. I basically want 2 screens with 2 cards i guess.
Any way to do it? Tried googling already yes.
Edit: I think the onboard card is SiS accelerated graphics port, that's in my systemdevice under computer management

item.title: 2 screens with different desktops
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

Alright thank you both.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 screens with different desktops
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

on newer motherboards you can plug a monitor into your integrated card and still use the main gfx card for display but since you have such an old card I don’t think it’s possible

Read full topic

item.title: 2 screens with different desktops
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:

I have 2 graphical cards, one Nvidea GeForce FX 5200 and an onboard card.
How can i make the onboard card work too, i’m currently using the Nvidea but that disabled my onboard card.
I basically want 2 screens with 2 cards i guess.

Any way to do it? Tried googling already yes.

Edit: I think the onboard card is SiS accelerated graphics port, that’s in my systemdevice under computer management[/quote]

I’m not sure if you can do it with an onboard card.

Read full topic
